newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -- Gillette down, Duracell up.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -- Gillette down, Duracell up.

text.p: Reports that Gillette Co will announce imminently the acqusition of Duracell International Inc for almost $59 per share in stock pushed Duracell shares up 6-1/8 to 54-1/2 in pre-open trade.
At the same time, Gillette stock fell to 63 from 65.
Sources familiar with the situation said Gillette will announce a $7 billion transaction shortly, possibly before the market open.
The deal values Duracell stock at 0.904 shares of Gillette, or $58.85 per share, the sources said.
Duracell and Gillette officials were not available for comment. Duracell's largest shareholder is buyout firm Kohlberg, Kravis Roberts and Co.
Bear Stearns and Goldman Sachs lowered their recommendations on the stock, according to sources at each firm.
Goldman cut the stock to market outperform from recommend and Bear Stearns dropped it to neutral from attractive.
Also, Intel Corp traded at 85-1/4 before the market open, a new year high.
The gain was 1/4 from yesterday's Nasdaq close, and 1/8 higher than the point reached in last night's after-hours trade.
